availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky, native. Son of John Murphy and Rachel Kyle Murphy. Married to Martha Wash Murphy in Scott County, Kentucky, on July 31, 1846. Father of James Murphy, Frances Ann Murphy Hamilton, Lucy Jane Murphy, John Murphy, Mary Elizabeth Murphy Traylor, and Martha Murphy Hudson. Farmer in Scott County in 1850. Employed Henry Estes as a laborer in Scott County in 1850. Farmer in Scott County in 1860. Employed Mary Edward in Scott County in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Scott County in 1863.
